snippet: The officers, who were initially detained in May, are accused of participating in trafficking with the Beltrán Leyva gang, which had been one of the biggest suppliers of cocaine to the United States.
abstract: Mexican prosecutors formally charge Tomas Angeles Dauahare, the deputy defense secretary from 2006 to 2008, and three other former officers with aiding drug traffickers in the biggest military corruption case in recent years.
lead_paragraph: The officers, who were initially detained in May, are accused of participating in trafficking with the Beltrán Leyva gang, which had been one of the biggest suppliers of cocaine to the United States.

headline.main: Mexico: Former Defense Officials Are Accused of Aiding Traffickers
headline.print_headline: Mexico: Former Defense Officials Are Accused of Aiding Traffickers
